Package org.jboss.windup.graph

Interface GraphContextFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphContextFactoryImpl
    public interface GraphContextFactory
    Responsible for creating new GraphContext instances.
    Author:
    Lincoln Baxter, III

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static String DEFAULT_GRAPH_SUBDIRECTORY

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_GRAPH_SUBDIRECTORY

        static final String DEFAULT_GRAPH_SUBDIRECTORY
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • create

        GraphContext create​(Path dir,
                    boolean enableListeners)
        Create a new GraphContext using the given Path as a file storage location. The Path will be created if it does not already exist. (**WARNING**: This will potentially delete all data in the given directory.)

        The enableListeners flag indicates whether or not mutation listeners should be enabled. Only a single open graph can have those at a time, and these should only be used for analysis runs.

      • create

        GraphContext create​(boolean enableListeners)
        Create a new GraphContext using a temporary file storage location.

        The enableListeners flag indicates whether or not mutation listeners should be enabled. Only a single open graph can have those at a time, and these should only be used for analysis runs.

      • load

        GraphContext load​(Path dir)
        Loads a GraphContext using the given Path as a file storage location.

      • closeAll

        void closeAll()
        Close all of the graphs that have been opened by this factory. This can be useful as a final cleanup to insure that all resources have been successfully destroyed.
